reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been planning our honeymoon to Vietnam and chose to stay at Thien Thanh for 9 nights, mainly due to the many wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor. I booked directly through the hotel website, also letting them know we were on our honeymoon. While in Hanoi we decided to spend another night in Hoi An, i e mailed them directly again and asked if we could possibly come 1 night earlier. In the email i stated we were very much looking forward to staying and relaxing on the last leg of our honeymoon. The reply was 'no problem please come 1 night earlier'.
reviews.title: Hotel Beautiful. Staff Even More So.

reviews.text: We arrived around 9pm and had a very disjointed abrupt welcome, not really a welcome at all. Then helped carry our own bags up 3 flights to be shown a room with twin beds... I said to the guy showing us the room that i had booked a double, he rang reception and we then traipsed down to level 2 only to be shown another room with twin beds. Now we are on our honeymoon, we do not wish to sleep in seperate beds. The guy rang reception again, then handed me the receiver, the young woman at the front desk told me, and i mean told me! that there were no double rooms available that night, our only option was the twin room.
reviews.title: Have a backup ready!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Call me old fashioned but i DO NOT consider this acceptable from any sort of establishment. They could quite easily have emailed and explained the situation, but chose to lie, what to get an extra night out of us??? We would not have left our lovely king size bed in Hanoi had we known that we would be housed in a twin room.
reviews.title: Treated like honored family

reviews.text: The woman was rude to the point of no return. There was no apology or eplanation. Just 'there are no double rooms tonight!'. The room we stayed in was at the back of the hotel yet was incredibly noisy. I spent the whole night listening to a little boy cry and an old women coughing up a lung.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Thien Thanh during our trip from Hanoi to HCMC. We had booked the room a few moths before our trip and had emailed the hotel two days before our arrival to confirm we would get the type of room we requested and paid for. We also arranged, through the hotel, for a driver to pick us up from Da Nang Airport ($12). The driver was waiting for us upon our arrival and got us to the Thien Thanh without any problem. It was when we arrived at the Thien Thanh that we had our first and only major annoyance/problem. We had booked a room with a balcony and view over the rice fields at the rear of the hotel. We arrived and were greeted somewhat coldly by the woman at the front desk. No big deal, we're not sensitive. However, when we were shown to our room it was a dark room with no balcony, one small window, and overlooking the dusty street at the front of the hotel. I hate having to confront hotel staff when tired after being up since 4AM but this was a room I knew was a step lower and cheaper than the one we booked. After going back down to the front desk and telling the desk manager about the discrepancy she gave us another room which had 2 twin beds instead of the full bed we booked, all the while maintaining her cold demeanor. The hotel rest of the staff also seemed slightly indifferent but not outwardly rude. Overall, our stay was pleasant and we met the hotel owner, who was very friendly. Between our stays in Hanoi and HCMC I would say that the hotel staff at the Thien Thanh was the least pleasant. Staff in HCMC and Hanoi were so much friendlier. I have no idea why. Beside our initial check in experience and the indifference of the staff we found the hotel to be well appointed with rooms and balconies overlooking quiet rice fields. Breakfast was included and the banana pancakes were awesome. If it weren't for that initial check-in experience and the untrained staff this hotel would have rated a lot higher.
reviews.title: Just OK (Polite Staff Could Have Made It Better)
